intro: Boehmeria gracilis, commonly known as slender hemp nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettle species. The plant has slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences. Boehmeria gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
